title: type suggestion
content:
Using Trade Gothic for a couple of things but the @ sign is looking a bit off

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201150335im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture3_3457.png)

Does anyone know another font that has a nice compressed '@' that i can replace this one with?

or will i have to fudge/draw it? :)
author: guiseiz

comments.content:
Hmmm... Does Stephen's suggestion mean that Trade Gothic character could just be replaced here with Solex?

I keep looking at these too and wondering: wouldn't it be awkward to use them together - Solex for copy; Trade Gothic Condensed for headlines for example?

"Ad augusta per angusta."
